title: scanning files
body: my client has to scan over 15,000 files every update (can take up toa bout 2 hour) and it does it twice, the first time it scans all the files and does the update till 99% and about 1mb left on the download then i have to scan again because it says theres an unexpected error but it does this e every single update no matter the size. Anyway ill be able to fix this ? get it to scan less files? on mac btw

replies.body:
Hit the panic button.

The Mac client is still in beta I believe? Anyway, for the moment, this isn't actually affecting your ability to play. It's just taking an absurdly long amount of time.

Do you regularly maintain your computer, such as cleaning it and making sure it has no viruses?

Yeah im pretty sure its still in beta, its just annyoing having to wait such a long amount of time for every update. 

yeah the computers always swept clean.

If you have any "file cleaners" on your Mac, try uninstalling it. Also, updates to your OS may actually be affecting League as well. Just test out not updating for one complete patch, to see if that's the reason.

Also, although I'm not 100% sure, try launching League with heightened privileges. Maybe it's just not being given permission to write the S_OK file?
